intro: Melandrium ostenfeldii, commonly known as the Ostenfeld's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, calcareous soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are clustered in racemes. Melandrium ostenfeldii is a perennial herb that is relatively rare and of conservation interest in some regions.
